issue.title: Collapse on Startup - Began after a system software update

content.raw:
I am also facing the drop/collapse of Val again after latest update Ubuntu 14.04.5, i7

When I run Qual1: The Val drops after detach. (From my previous successful experience I observe that in cases of success Val stands stable on ground with soles on the green line before detach, but in present case it is slightly above the ground, and thus when it is detached, it falls and is not able to maintain the balance)

In qual2: It starts walking, but in midway it is not able to step properly (steps over its own foot) and falls. Here the console output shows an error message:

[ERROR] [1480738526.831108059, 31.074000000]: us.ihmc.tools.exceptions.NoConvergenceException
[ERROR] [1480738526.831376981, 31.074000000]: 	at us.ihmc.commonWalkingControlModules.momentumBasedController.optimization.InverseDynamicsQPSolver.solve(InverseDynamicsQPSolver.java:337)
[ERROR] [1480738526.831536516, 31.074000000]: 	at us.ihmc.commonWalkingControlModules.momentumBasedController.optimization.InverseDynamicsOptimizationControlModule.compute(InverseDynamicsOptimizationControlModule.java:161)
[ERROR] [1480738526.831667449, 31.074000000]: 	at us.ihmc.commonWalkingControlModules.controllerCore.WholeBodyInverseDynamicsSolver.compute(WholeBodyInverseDynamicsSolver.java:137)
[ERROR] [1480738526.831790161, 31.074000000]: 	at us.ihmc.commonWalkingControlModules.controllerCore.WholeBodyControllerCore.doInverseDynamics(WholeBodyControllerCore.java:162)
[ERROR] [1480738526.831908425, 31.074000000]: 	at us.ihmc.commonWalkingControlModules.controllerCore.WholeBodyControllerCore.compute(WholeBodyControllerCore.java:134)
[ERROR] [1480738526.832027921, 31.074000000]: 	at us.ihmc.commonWalkingControlModules.highLevelHumanoidControl.HighLevelHumanoidControllerManager.doControl(HighLevelHumanoidControllerManager.java:183)
[ERROR] [1480738526.832143307, 31.074000000]: 	at us.ihmc.simulationconstructionset.robotController.ModularRobotController.doControl(ModularRobotController.java:20)
[ERROR] [1480738526.832252879, 31.074000000]: 	at us.ihmc.wholeBodyController.DRCControllerThread.run(DRCControllerThread.java:352)
[ERROR] [1480738526.832368553, 31.074000000]: 	at us.ihmc.wholeBodyController.concurrent.SynchronousMultiThreadedRobotController$ReentrantLockedControlElementRunner.run(SynchronousMultiThreadedRobotController.java:89)
[ERROR] [1480738526.832510437, 31.074000000]: 	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
[ INFO] [1480738526.833021613, 31.074000000]: [WARN] (InverseDynamicsOptimizationControlModule.java:169): Only showing the stack trace of the first NoConvergenceException. This may be happening more than once.
Attached is my ros env
I think this is some dependency issue, some environment variable is not properly set, but which no idea...

![Screenshot from 2016-12-03 09:56:22.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/xEbAAe/images/782946640-Screenshot_from_2016-12-03_095622.png)
content.html:
I am also facing the drop/collapse of Val again after latest update Ubuntu 14.04.5, i7

When I run Qual1: The Val drops after detach. (From my previous successful experience I observe that in cases of success Val stands stable on ground with soles on the green line before detach, but in present case it is slightly above the ground, and thus when it is detached, it falls and is not able to maintain the balance)

In qual2: It starts walking, but in midway it is not able to step properly (steps over its own foot) and falls. Here the console output shows an error message:

[ERROR] [1480738526.831108059, 31.074000000]: us.ihmc.tools.exceptions.NoConvergenceException [ERROR] [1480738526.831376981, 31.074000000]: at us.ihmc.commonWalkingControlModules.momentumBasedController.optimization.InverseDynamicsQPSolver.solve(InverseDynamicsQPSolver.java:337) [ERROR] [1480738526.831536516, 31.074000000]: at us.ihmc.commonWalkingControlModules.momentumBasedController.optimization.InverseDynamicsOptimizationControlModule.compute(InverseDynamicsOptimizationControlModule.java:161) [ERROR] [1480738526.831667449, 31.074000000]: at us.ihmc.commonWalkingControlModules.controllerCore.WholeBodyInverseDynamicsSolver.compute(WholeBodyInverseDynamicsSolver.java:137) [ERROR] [1480738526.831790161, 31.074000000]: at us.ihmc.commonWalkingControlModules.controllerCore.WholeBodyControllerCore.doInverseDynamics(WholeBodyControllerCore.java:162) [ERROR] [1480738526.831908425, 31.074000000]: at us.ihmc.commonWalkingControlModules.controllerCore.WholeBodyControllerCore.compute(WholeBodyControllerCore.java:134) [ERROR] [1480738526.832027921, 31.074000000]: at us.ihmc.commonWalkingControlModules.highLevelHumanoidControl.HighLevelHumanoidControllerManager.doControl(HighLevelHumanoidControllerManager.java:183) [ERROR] [1480738526.832143307, 31.074000000]: at us.ihmc.simulationconstructionset.robotController.ModularRobotController.doControl(ModularRobotController.java:20) [ERROR] [1480738526.832252879, 31.074000000]: at us.ihmc.wholeBodyController.DRCControllerThread.run(DRCControllerThread.java:352) [ERROR] [1480738526.832368553, 31.074000000]: at us.ihmc.wholeBodyController.concurrent.SynchronousMultiThreadedRobotController$ReentrantLockedControlElementRunner.run(SynchronousMultiThreadedRobotController.java:89) [ERROR] [1480738526.832510437, 31.074000000]: at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745) [ INFO] [1480738526.833021613, 31.074000000]: [WARN] (InverseDynamicsOptimizationControlModule.java:169): Only showing the stack trace of the first NoConvergenceException. This may be happening more than once. Attached is my ros env I think this is some dependency issue, some environment variable is not properly set, but which no idea...
